info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 09 at 5:31PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Navajo and Coconino Counties through 600 PM MST... At 531 PM MST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles west of First Mesa, or 18 miles west of Keams Canyon, moving west at 30 mph. HAZARD...Penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... First Mesa, Hard Rock, Second Mesa, Kykotsmovi Village, Polacca, Hotevilla, Shongopovi and Hopi Reservation. This includes the following highways... State Route 264 between mile markers 358 and 395. State Route 87 between mile markers 393 and 406. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
